did.head: Descriptive Summary

did.abstract: Photograph album containing 202 images from the Union Elektricitaets-Gesellschaft Company factory in Berlin, Germany, showing factory interior and exterior views, a cable car, and various company products, including meters and generators.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Union Elektricitaets-Gesellschaft Company (UEG) of Berlin originated in the United States in January, 1892 when the Thomson-Houston Electric Company founded the UEG as its subsidiary in Germany. Six months later, Thomson-Houston merged with Edison General Electric Company to form General Electric.

UEG designed, manufactured, and operated electric trams throughout the world. The company also manufactured electric locomotives for railways. On July 1, 1903, UEG combined with the Allgemeinen Elektritaets-Gesellschaft (AEG), forming AEG Union, which, in turn, merged into Aktiengesellschaft fur Elektrische Industrie (ELIN) in 1959.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of a single photograph album containing photos from the Union Elektricitaets-Gesellschaft Company of Berlin, Germany. The photos include both interior and exterior views of the company's factory and many of its products, including meters, dynamos, and a cable car.
